## Bundle.BundleUtils class

Utility functions for working with resource bundles. Provides reusable logic for bundle detection, parsing, and component extraction.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare class BundleUtils 
```

## Methods

<table><thead><tr><th>

Method


</th><th>

Modifiers


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

[extractBundleComponents(bundleData)](./ts-res.bundle.bundleutils.extractbundlecomponents.md)


</td><td>

`static`


</td><td>

Extracts and validates components from a bundle for reuse. Performs full validation of the bundle structure and creates typed components.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[extractBundleMetadata(data)](./ts-res.bundle.bundleutils.extractbundlemetadata.md)


</td><td>

`static`


</td><td>

Extracts just the metadata from potential bundle data without full validation. Useful for displaying bundle information without processing the entire bundle.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[isBundleFile(data)](./ts-res.bundle.bundleutils.isbundlefile.md)


</td><td>

`static`


</td><td>

Checks if the given object appears to be a bundle file by examining its structure. This is a lightweight check that doesn't perform full validation.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[isBundleFileName(fileName)](./ts-res.bundle.bundleutils.isbundlefilename.md)


</td><td>

`static`


</td><td>

Checks if a file name suggests it might be a bundle file. This is a heuristic check based on file naming conventions.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[parseBundleFromJson(jsonString)](./ts-res.bundle.bundleutils.parsebundlefromjson.md)


</td><td>

`static`


</td><td>

Parses bundle data from a JSON string. Convenience method that combines JSON parsing with bundle component extraction.


</td></tr>
